intro: Labisia alata, commonly known as the winged labisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive winged leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and usually pink or white, arranged in clusters. Labisia alata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
